newsitem.title: UK: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - June 29.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - June 29.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in two London-based Arabic-language newspapers on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Saudi defence minister discusses with officials ways to boost Saudi airforce.
- Qatar understands why some Arab states would boycott the economic summit due to be held in Qatar in November.
- Kuwaiti government sets up a telecommunications firm with a capital of 30 million dinars.
- Kuwaiti Development Fund lends Egypt 15 million dinars for the second phase of a social fund project.
- Saudi crown prince leaves Lebanon to Syria.
- Trade between Gulf states and Hong Kong would not be affected after the handover to China.
- An Egyptian group undertakes five projects costing 420 million pounds in different sectors.
